xxl.applications.pipes
Class SWTPerformanceMonitor

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
          org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
              org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
                  xxl.applications.pipes.SWTPerformanceMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable
public class SWTPerformanceMonitor
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite

This class provides a metadata monitoring tool. It uses the SWT and needs swt.jar and plattfrom dependent libraries during run-time.

Nested Class Summary
 class SWTPerformanceMonitor.MetaDataAccessor
          An inner class that refreshes the metadata periodically.

SWTPerformanceMonitor

SWTPerformanceMonitor

protected SWTPerformanceMonitor(CompositeMetaData<Object,Object> md,
                                String name,
                                org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                                int style,
                                boolean internalCall,
                                boolean historicMode,
                                boolean showMDOnStart)
Creates a new SWTPerformanceMonitor with the specified parameters. It is only invoked by the Factory Methods and by the pipes demo.

Parameters:
md - the metadata provider.
name - the name of the composite.
parent - allows to place the monitor in arbitary composite.
style - an swt style.
internalCall - a flag to determine, if the shell name should be changed.
showMDOnStart - shows all metadata if set to true

SWTPerformanceMonitor

public SWTPerformanceMonitor(CompositeMetaData md,
                             org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                             int style)
Creates a new SWTPerformanceMonitor with the specified parameters.

Parameters:
md - the metadata provider.
parent - allows to place the monitor in arbitary composite.
style - an swt style.

Parameters:

name - displays the given name in the shell.

startMetaDataAccessor

public void startMetaDataAccessor()
Start the metadata accessor that reads metadata periodically and paints them.

stopMetaDataAccessor

public void stopMetaDataAccessor()
Terminates the metadata accessor.

paint

public void paint(Object newValues)
Paints the metadata. Each meata data is visualized in a separate window.

Parameters:
newValues - the new values of the meta data.

addCanvas

public org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas addCanvas(String name)
Adds a canvas in the composite c. This happens, when a metadata button is activated.

Parameters:
name - the name of the canvas.
Returns:
the canvas.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Provides an example.

Parameters:
args - is ignored.
